channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Killamarsh deaths: Family's tribute to children found dead at house
item.description: The two children were found dead along with their mother and another child in Killamarsh, Derbyshire

item.title: Harry Dunn: Liz Truss raises case with US at United Nations Assembly
item.description: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss spoke to the US Secretary of State about the need for justice.

item.title: Kidbrooke death: Teacher found dead near community centre named
item.description: The south-east London school where Sabina Nessa worked pays tribute to the "brilliant" teacher.

item.title: M25 protests: Arrests made as Insulate Britain blocks motorway
item.description: Insulate Britain protesters blocked traffic on both carriageways of the motorway in Surrey earlier.

item.title: The torso in the Thames: A 20-year mystery
item.description: Twenty years ago, a young African boy was murdered and his torso was dumped in the Thames. It's the longest unsolved child murder case in the recent history of the Metropolitan Police.

item.title: Lewis Bloor: Towie star 'part of £3m diamond scam'
item.description: Lewis Bloor is accused of being part of a group who conned people into buying "valueless" stones.

item.title: Bluebird: Campbell's daughter says craft will return to Coniston Water
item.description: The original parts are to be returned to a Coniston museum after its restoration was taken apart.

item.title: Motor neurone disease: Campaigners call for £50m research funding
item.description: Chris Johnson, who has motor neurone disease, says life-saving treatment is almost in sight.

item.title: Wally the wandering walrus is spotted in Iceland
item.description: The 800kg mammal had not been seen for more than three weeks.

item.title: Gateshead traffic gridlock prompts urgent investigation
item.description: Gateshead Council says it is looking into last week's congestion as "a matter of urgency".

item.title: Ipswich runner Millie King: 'You've got to be the best you can be'
item.description: The 16-year-old sprinter gets two England call-ups after focusing on training during the pandemic.

item.title: Baby squirrel abandoned on Cambridge patio bonds with carer
item.description: The squirrel, named Paquito, formed an unexpected friendship with his temporary carer.

item.title: Salford woman shares photographs of eczema flare-ups
item.description: Kymmene Dawson shares photographs of stages of eczema flare-ups to raise awareness of the condition.

item.title: 'Dachshund disco is a children's party for your dog'
item.description: Organisers James Morgan and Anushka Fernando want to help dogs socialise again after lockdown.

item.title: Manchester music cafe brings joy to people with dementia
item.description: People with dementia sing, play instruments and dance at the music cafe, says Manchester Camerata.

item.title: Jones makes major changes to England squad
item.description: England boss Eddie Jones sets about a major shake-up in his squad by leaving out a host of big names for a training camp later this month.

item.title: Anthony Joshua v Oleksandr Usyk: Ukrainian 'jumping in at deep end' with world heavyweight title bid
item.description: Anthony Joshua commends Oleksandr Usyk for "jumping in at the deep end" with a world heavyweight title tilt after just two fights in the class.

item.title: Murray 'not going to wade in' with advice for Raducanu
item.description: Andy Murray says he would "always be on the end of the phone" to give Emma Raducanu help - but only if she asks for it.

item.title: County Championship 2021: Which of the four contenders will win the title?
item.description: Who plays who, who needs what and who's heading for the pavilion for the last time as the 2021 County Championship enters its final week.

item.title: England's men's and women's team withdrawn from Pakistan white-ball tour
item.description: England withdraw their men's and women's teams from series in Pakistan that were due to take place in October.
